title: User Calculator Navigation and Access
description: Verify that a user can navigate through the dynamic dropdown menu to select a service module and open the corresponding calculator without errors.

steps.description: Navigate to the home page.
Locate the dynamic dropdown for service module selection.
Select the 'Civil' service module from the dropdown.
Verify that the Civil calculator page is displayed correctly.
Repeat selection for 'Electrical' and verify its calculator opens properly.
Repeat selection for 'HVAC' and verify its calculator opens properly.
Ensure no errors or UI glitches appear during navigation and calculator load.

title: Theme Upload and Validation
description: Test the ability for an administrator to upload a new theme, trigger validation checks, and handle invalid themes properly.

steps.description: Login as an administrator and navigate to /admin/themes.
Attempt to upload a well-formed theme package.
Confirm that theme validation passes and the theme is added to the list.
Attempt to upload a malformed theme missing required files or invalid manifest.
Validate that the system rejects the theme with an appropriate error message.

title: Activate and Customize Theme with Dynamic CSS Application
description: Verify that an administrator can activate a theme, customize its settings, and that the dynamic CSS is applied correctly on the front end.

steps.description: Navigate to the themes management page and activate a valid theme.
Confirm the theme is marked as active in the system.
Apply customization settings for the active theme (e.g., colors, fonts).
Verify that the front end reflects the customized styles via dynamic CSS without page reload errors.

title: Plugin Upload, Validation, Activation Toggle, and Deletion
description: Ensure that plugin management allows for correct upload, manifest validation, toggling activation state, and deletion without system errors.

steps.description: Access plugin management interface as admin.
Upload a valid plugin package.
Verify plugin manifest validation passes and plugin is listed.
Toggle plugin activation on and verify status changes accordingly.
Check no system errors occur upon activation toggle.
Delete the uploaded plugin.
Confirm plugin is removed and system stability is maintained.
Upload a plugin with invalid manifest data.
Verify that the upload is rejected with clear validation error.

title: Backup Creation, Export, and Restore
description: Test the backup system by creating backups, exporting backup files, restoring system state, and ensuring data integrity.

steps.description: Login as admin and visit /admin/help backup section.
Initiate a new full system backup.
Confirm backup completes successfully including database dump and theme/plugin assets.
Download the created backup file.
Verify downloaded file integrity and completeness.
Modify system data, then perform a restore from the saved backup.
Validate the system state returns exactly to the backup state without data loss.

title: Audit Log Filtering and Download
description: Confirm that an administrator can apply advanced filters to audit logs and download the filtered entries without corruption or errors.

steps.description: Navigate to /admin/audit-logs page.
Apply filters by date range, user, and action type.
Verify the audit log list updates according to applied filters.
Download the filtered audit logs as a file.
Confirm the downloaded audit log file contains correct, uncorrupted data matching the filter criteria.

title: Security: Rate Limiting and CSRF Protection on Admin POST Routes
description: Verify that administrative POST endpoints enforce rate limiting and require valid CSRF tokens to prevent unauthorized or excessive access.

steps.description: Attempt several rapid consecutive POST requests to an admin endpoint without valid CSRF tokens.
Confirm requests without CSRF token are rejected with appropriate error.
Submit POST requests with valid CSRF tokens exceeding the allowed rate limit.
Verify that excess requests are throttled and proper rate limit response is returned.
Submit POST requests within limits and with valid CSRF tokens.
Ensure requests complete successfully without false negatives.

title: System Structured Logging and Audit Log Records
description: Test that system events are logged with structured data and audit-specific records capture the necessary information for compliance.

steps.description: Trigger system events including theme activation, plugin upload, and user calculator access.
Inspect logs to verify structured format with timestamps, event types, and actor details.
Perform an admin action requiring audit logging.
Verify audit logger records include all mandatory fields and event details.

title: API v1 Health Endpoint Response
description: Validate the health check API at /api/v1/health returns a 200 HTTP status with correct JSON structure indicating system availability.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/v1/health endpoint.
Verify response code is 200 OK.
Confirm response content is JSON formatted and indicates system health status accurately.

title: API v1 Calculators and History Data Retrieval
description: Test API endpoints that provide calculator data and usage history return correct data formats and handle invalid requests gracefully.

steps.description: Send GET request to /api/v1/calculators for available calculators.
Verify response contains a valid JSON list of calculators with expected fields.
Send GET request to /api/v1/history with valid user parameters.
Confirm the response returns a JSON-formatted history dataset matching the request parameters.
Send GET request to /api/v1/history with invalid or missing parameters.
Verify the API handles the error gracefully, returning appropriate status code and error message.
